summary: This module implements a parser for URL-encoded form data (application/x-www-form-urlencoded) using the Apache Portable Runtime library. It provides functionality to parse and decode URL parameters, handling character encoding issues and maintaining parameter state across multiple calls.

logs.reason: Empty parameter name encountered during URL parsing. This occurs when a parameter has no name before the equals sign.
logs.resolution: Ensure that all URL parameters have non-empty names. Check the form submission code to prevent empty parameter names.

logs.reason: Failed to allocate memory for parameter storage. The system is likely running out of memory.
logs.resolution: Check the server's memory usage and consider increasing available memory or implementing memory limits on request processing.

logs.reason: General error during URL-encoded data parsing. This happens when the parser context enters an error state.
logs.resolution: Check the request data for malformed URL encoding. This could be caused by invalid characters or truncated input.

logs.reason: Parsing of URL-encoded data is incomplete and requires more input data to complete.
logs.resolution: This is an informational status rather than an error. The caller should provide more data and call the parser again until processing is complete.

logs.reason: Error status set when bucket reading fails or parameter splitting encounters an error.
logs.resolution: Verify the integrity of the input data and check for malformed URL encoding. Network issues might be causing data corruption.
